title: and 48 of the Greyhound Industry Act 1958 (No. 12 of 1958), and also by subsection (3) of section 5 of said 1958 Act, hereby makes the following regulations,
heading: 1. These regulations may be cited as the Greyhound Industry (Racing)
text_raw:
1. These regulations may be cited as the Greyhound Industry (Racing) 

(Amendment) Regulations, 2021.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited greyhound industry (racing) (amendment) regulation 2021

title: and 48 of the Greyhound Industry Act 1958 (No. 12 of 1958), and also by subsection (3) of section 5 of said 1958 Act, hereby makes the following regulations,
heading: 2. These regulations and the Greyhound Industry (Racing) Regulations
text_raw:
2. These regulations and the Greyhound Industry (Racing) Regulations 
2007 to 2017 may be cited together as the Greyhound Industry (Racing) 
Regulations, 2007 to 2021.
text_norm: 2 regulation greyhound industry (racing) regulation 2007 2017 may cited together greyhound industry (racing) regulation 2007 2021

title: and 48 of the Greyhound Industry Act 1958 (No. 12 of 1958), and also by subsection (3) of section 5 of said 1958 Act, hereby makes the following regulations,
heading: 3. Article 7 of the Greyhound Industry (Racing) Regulations, 2007 (S.I. No.
text_raw:
3. Article 7 of the Greyhound Industry (Racing) Regulations, 2007 (S.I. No. 
302 of 2007), is hereby amended by the substitution of the following sub-article 
for sub-article 4. 

(4) Notwithstanding whether or not such request is made, the Racing 
Manager, in consultation with the Control Steward, shall consider all 
entries for such a race or feature event and may on the information 
available to them classify a greyhound as a Wide or Middle Runner under 
this regulation for such race or for the first round of such feature event. 
The Racing Manager shall not alter or add to such classifications for any 
further round of such feature event except that in a feature event of three 
or more rounds, he/she may revise them for the second round, in which 
case the revised classifications shall stand for the remaining round(s). 
Classifications shall thus not be altered for the final of any feature event.”
text_norm: 3 article 7 greyhound industry (racing) regulation 2007 (s.i no 302 2007) hereby amended substitution following sub-article sub-article 4 (4) notwithstanding whether request made racing manager consultation control steward shall consider entry race feature event may information available classify greyhound wide middle runner regulation race first round feature event racing manager shall alter add classification round feature event except feature event three round may revise second round case revised classification shall stand remaining round(s) classification shall thus altered final feature event

title: and 48 of the Greyhound Industry Act 1958 (No. 12 of 1958), and also by subsection (3) of section 5 of said 1958 Act, hereby makes the following regulations,
heading: 4. Article 15 of the Greyhound Industry (Racing) Regulations, 2007 (S.I.

4. Article 15 of the Greyhound Industry (Racing) Regulations, 2007 (S.I. 
No. 302 of 2007), is hereby amended by the substitution of the following article.
text_norm: 4 article 15 greyhound industry (racing) regulation 2007 (s.i no 302 2007) hereby amended substitution following article

title: and 48 of the Greyhound Industry Act 1958 (No. 12 of 1958), and also by subsection (3) of section 5 of said 1958 Act, hereby makes the following regulations,
heading: 15. Where two or more greyhounds registered in the same ownership
text_raw:
15. Where two or more greyhounds registered in the same ownership 
or in the same partnership are entered for an event with eliminating heats 
the greyhounds shall not be guarded by the race track executive at any 
stage of the event and this provision shall additionally apply where one 
or more greyhounds listed as reserves replace withdrawn greyhounds.
text_norm: 15 two greyhound registered ownership partnership entered event eliminating heat greyhound shall guarded race track executive stage event provision shall additionally apply one greyhound listed reserve replace withdrawn greyhound

title: and 48 of the Greyhound Industry Act 1958 (No. 12 of 1958), and also by subsection (3) of section 5 of said 1958 Act, hereby makes the following regulations,
heading: 5. These regulations shall come into effect on the 1st day of February 2021.
text_raw:
5. These regulations shall come into effect on the 1st day of February 2021. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 19th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [10] 3

title: and 48 of the Greyhound Industry Act 1958 (No. 12 of 1958), and also by subsection (3) of section 5 of said 1958 Act, hereby makes the following regulations,
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The effect of these regulations is to amend the Greyhound Industry (Racing) 
Regulations 2007 to 2017 so as to provide that: 

i. 

ii. 

the number of rounds in an event with eliminating rounds where a 
seeding category can be changed is three or more. Seeding categories 
may be amended after the first round but may not be altered thereafter. 

greyhounds registered in the same ownership or in the same partnership 
which are entered for an event with eliminating heats, will not be guarded 
at any stage of the event. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [10] 5
